Detailed Description

A fixed-stepsize co-simulation algorithm.

A simple implementation of algorithm. The simulation progresses at a fixed base stepsize. Simulators are stepped in parallel at an optional multiple of this base step size.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

cse::fixed_step_algorithm::fixed_step_algorithm ( duration  baseStepSize)
explicit

Constructor.

Parameters
baseStepSizeThe base communication interval length.

Member Function Documentation

◆ add_connection()

void cse::fixed_step_algorithm::add_connection ( std::shared_ptr< connection >  conn)
overridevirtual

Adds a connection to the co-simulation.

After this, the algorithm is responsible for acquiring the values of the connection's source variables, and distributing the connection's destination variable values at communication points.

It is assumed that the variables contained by the connection are valid and that there are no existing connections to any of the connection's destination variables.

Implements cse::algorithm.

◆ add_simulator()

void cse::fixed_step_algorithm::add_simulator ( simulator_index  index,
simulator *  sim,
duration  stepSizeHint 
)
overridevirtual

Adds a simulator to the co-simulation.

Parameters
indexA numerical index that will be used to identify the simulator in other function calls.
simA pointer to an object that is used to control the simulator. Note that the algorithm does not have resource ownership of the object it points to (i.e., should not try to delete it).
stepSizeHintThe recommended co-simulation step size for this simulator. The algorithm is free to choose whether and how this is taken into account. The algorithm is also responsible for selecting a sensible default if this is zero.

Implements cse::algorithm.

◆ do_step()

std::pair<duration, std::unordered_set<simulator_index> > cse::fixed_step_algorithm::do_step ( time_point  currentT)
overridevirtual

Performs a single macro time step.

The actual time step length is determined by the algorithm, but it may not exceed maxDeltaT if specified.

This function is guaranteed to be called after initialize(). The first time it is called, currentT will be equal to the startTime argument passed to setup().

Parameters
currentTThe starting point of the time step.
Returns
The actual time step length, which must be less than or equal to maxDeltaT, if specified.

Implements cse::algorithm.

◆ initialize()

void cse::fixed_step_algorithm::initialize ( )
overridevirtual

Initializes the co-simulation.

Typically, this function will set the initial values of simulator variables, possibly performing iterative initialization to steady-state values for some of them.

This function is guaranteed to be called after setup() and before the first do_step() call.

Implements cse::algorithm.

◆ remove_connection()

void cse::fixed_step_algorithm::remove_connection ( std::shared_ptr< connection >  conn)
overridevirtual

Removes a connection from the co-simulation.

It is assumed that the connection has previously been added to the co-simulation with add_connection().

Implements cse::algorithm.

◆ remove_simulator()

void cse::fixed_step_algorithm::remove_simulator ( simulator_index  index)
overridevirtual

Removes a simulator from the co-simulation.

Parameters
indexThe index of a simulator that has previously been added to the co-simulation with add_simulator().

Implements cse::algorithm.

◆ set_stepsize_decimation_factor()

void cse::fixed_step_algorithm::set_stepsize_decimation_factor ( simulator_index  simulator,
int  factor 
)

Sets step size decimation factor for a simulator.

This will effectively set the simulator step size to a multiple of the algorithm's base step size. The default decimation factor is 1. Must be called after the simulator has been added to the algorithm with add_simulator().

Parameters
simulatorThe index of the simulator.
factorThe stepsize decimation factor.

◆ setup()

void cse::fixed_step_algorithm::setup ( time_point  startTime,
std::optional< time_point >  stopTime 
)
overridevirtual

Performs initial setup.

This function is guaranteed to be called before initialize().

Parameters
startTimeThe logical time at which the simulation will start. (The first time do_step() is called, its currentT argument will have the same value.)
stopTimeThe logical time at which the simulation will end. If specified, the algorithm will not be stepped beyond this point.

Implements cse::algorithm.
